title: Ticket #4368: Checksum always fails on non-blocking read for ReliSock
description: The non-blocking read code recently added in ReliSock introduces a bug in checksum checking. In ReliSock::RcvMsg::rcv_packet(), when a partial CEDAR packet is read, the checksum in the header (if there is one) isn't saved. Thus, when the rest of the packet is read in a later call, uninitialized data from the stack is used as the checksum that the packet's contents are checked against, which will always fail.
